title: Basic definitions
content: An "extensible structure" (or "structure" in short, at least in this section) is used to define a specific group, ring, poset, and so on. An extensible structure can contain many components. For example, a group will have at least two components (base set and operation), although it can be further specialized by adding other components such as a multiplicative operation for rings (and still remain a group per our definition). Thus, every ring is also a group. This extensible structure approach allows theorems from more general structures (such as groups) to be reused for more specialized structures (such as rings) without having to reprove anything. Structures are common in mathematics, but in informal (natural language) proofs the details are assumed in ways that we must make explicit. An extensible structure is implemented as a function (a set of ordered pairs) on a finite (and not necessarily sequential) subset of ` NN ` . The function's argument is the index of a structure component (such as ` 1 ` for the base set of a group), and its value is the component (such as the base set). By convention, we normally avoid direct reference to the hard-coded numeric index and instead use structure component extractors such as ~ ndxid and ~ strfv . Using extractors makes it easier to change numeric indices and also makes the components' purpose clearer. For example, as noted in ~ ndxid , we can refer to a specific poset with base set ` B ` and order relation ` L ` using the extensible structure ` { <. ( Base `` ndx ) , B >. , <. ( le `` ndx ) , L >. } ` rather than ` { <. 1 , B >. , <. ; 1 0 , L >. } ` . There are many other possible ways to handle structures. We chose this extensible structure approach because this approach (1) results in simpler notation than other approaches we are aware of, and (2) is easier to do proofs with. We cannot use an approach that uses "hidden" arguments; Metamath does not support hidden arguments, and in any case we want nothing hidden. It would be possible to use a categorical approach (e.g., something vaguely similar to Lean's mathlib). However, instances (the chain of proofs that an ` X ` is a ` Y ` via a bunch of forgetful functors) can cause serious performance problems for automated tooling, and the resulting proofs would be painful to look at directly (in the case of Lean, they are long past the level where people would find it acceptable to look at them directly). Metamath is working under much stricter conditions than this, and it has still managed to achieve about the same level of flexibility through this "extensible structure" approach. To create a substructure of a given extensible structure, you can simply use the multifunction restriction operator for extensible structures ` |``s ` as defined in ~ df-ress . This can be used to turn statements about rings into statements about subrings, modules into submodules, etc. This definition knows nothing about individual structures and merely truncates the ` Base ` set while leaving operators alone. Individual kinds of structures will need to handle this behavior by ignoring operators' values outside the range (like ` Ring ` ), defining a function using the base set and applying that (like ` TopGrp ` ), or explicitly truncating the slot before use (like ` MetSp ` ). For example, the unital ring of integers ` ZZring ` is defined in ~ df-zring as simply ` ZZring = ( CCfld |``s ZZ ) ` . This can be similarly done for all other subsets of ` CC ` , which has all the structure we can show applies to it, and this all comes "for free". Should we come up with some new structure in the future that we wish ` CC ` to inherit, then we change the definition of ` CCfld ` , reprove all the slot extraction theorems, add a new one, and that's it. None of the other downstream theorems have to change. Note that the construct of ~ df-prds addresses a different situation. It is not possible to have SubGroup and SubRing be the same thing because they produce different outputs on the same input. The subgroups of an extensible structure treated as a group are not the same as the subrings of that same structure. With ~ df-prds it can actually reasonably perform the task, that is, being the product group given a family of groups, while also being the product ring given a family of rings. There is no contradiction here because the group part of a product ring is a product group. There is also a general theory of "substructure algebras", in the form of ~ df-mre and ~ df-acs . SubGroup is a Moore collection, as is SubRing, SubRng and many other substructure collections. But it is not useful for picking out a particular collection of interest; SubRing and SubGroup still need to be defined and they are distinct --- nothing is going to select these definitions for us. Extensible structures only work well when they represent concrete categories, where there is a "base set", morphisms are functions, and subobjects are subsets with induced operations. In short, they primarily work well for "sets with (some) extra structure". Extensible structures may not suffice for more complicated situations. For example, in manifolds, ` |``s ` would not work. That said, extensible structures are sufficient for many of the structures that set.mm currently considers, and offer a good compromise for a goal-oriented formalization.

df-struct
blocks.content: Define a structure with components in ` M ... N ` . This is not a requirement for groups, posets, etc., but it is a useful assumption for component extraction theorems. As mentioned in the section header, an "extensible structure should be implemented as a function (a set of ordered pairs)". The current definition, however, is less restrictive: it allows for classes which contain the empty set ` (/) ` to be extensible structures. Because of ~ 0nelfun , such classes cannot be functions. Without the empty set, however, a structure must be a function, see ~ structn0fun : ` F Struct X -> Fun ( F \ { (/) } ) ` . Allowing an extensible structure to contain the empty set ensures that expressions like ` { <. A , B >. , <. C , D >. } ` are structures without asserting or implying that ` A ` , ` B ` , ` C ` and ` D ` are sets (if ` A ` or ` B ` is a proper class, then ` <. A , B >. = (/) ` , see ~ opprc ). This is used critically in ~ strle1 , ~ strle2 , ~ strle3 and ~ strleun to avoid sethood hypotheses on the "payload" sets: without this, ~ ipsstr and theorems like it will have many sethood assumptions, and may not even be usable in the empty context. Instead, the sethood assumption is deferred until it is actually needed, e.g., ~ ipsbase , which requires that the base set be a set but not any of the other components. Usually, a concrete structure like ` CCfld ` does not contain the empty set, and therefore is a function, see ~ cnfldfun . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 29-Aug-2015.)

blocks.name: df-ndx
blocks.content: Define the structure component index extractor. See theorem ~ ndxarg to understand its purpose. The restriction to ` NN ` ensures that ` ndx ` is a set. The restriction to some set is necessary since ` _I ` is a proper class. In principle, we could have chosen ` CC ` or (if we revise all structure component definitions such as ~ df-base ) another set such as the set of finite ordinals ` _om ` ( ~ df-om ). (Contributed by NM, 4-Sep-2011.)

blocks.name: df-slot
blocks.content: Define the slot extractor for extensible structures. The class ` Slot A ` is a function whose argument can be any set, although it is meaningful only if that set is a member of an extensible structure (such as a partially ordered set ( ~ df-poset ) or a group ( ~ df-grp )). Note that ` Slot A ` is implemented as "evaluation at ` A ` ". That is, ` ( Slot A `` S ) ` is defined to be ` ( S `` A ) ` , where ` A ` will typically be a small nonzero natural number. Each extensible structure ` S ` is a function defined on specific natural number "slots", and this function extracts the value at a particular slot. The special "structure" ` ndx ` , defined as the identity function restricted to ` NN ` , can be used to extract the number ` A ` from a slot, since ` ( Slot A `` ndx ) = A ` (see ~ ndxarg ). This is typically used to refer to the number of a slot when defining structures without having to expose the detail of what that number is (for instance, we use the expression ` ( Base `` ndx ) ` in theorems and proofs instead of its value 1). The class ` Slot ` cannot be defined as ` ( x e. _V |-> ( f e. _V |-> ( f `` x ) ) ) ` because each ` Slot A ` is a function on the proper class ` _V ` so is itself a proper class, and the values of functions are sets ( ~ fvex ). It is necessary to allow proper classes as values of ` Slot A ` since for instance the class of all (base sets of) groups is proper. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 22-Sep-2015.)

blocks.name: sloteq
blocks.content: Equality theorem for the ` Slot ` construction. The converse holds if ` A ` (or ` B ` ) is a set. (Contributed by BJ, 27-Dec-2021.)

blocks.name: df-base
blocks.content: Define the base set (also called underlying set, ground set, carrier set, or carrier) extractor for extensible structures. (Contributed by NM, 4-Sep-2011.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 14-Aug-2015.)

blocks.name: df-sets
blocks.content: Set a component of an extensible structure. This function is useful for taking an existing structure and "overriding" one of its components. For example, ~ df-ress adjusts the base set to match its second argument, which has the effect of making subgroups, subspaces, subrings etc. from the original structures. Or ~ df-mgp , which takes a ring and overrides its addition operation with the multiplicative operation, so that we can consider the "multiplicative group" using group and monoid theorems, which expect the operation to be in the ` +g ` slot instead of the ` .r ` slot. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 1-Dec-2014.)

blocks.name: df-ress
blocks.content: Define a multifunction restriction operator for extensible structures, which can be used to turn statements about rings into statements about subrings, modules into submodules, etc. This definition knows nothing about individual structures and merely truncates the ` Base ` set while leaving operators alone; individual kinds of structures will need to handle this behavior, by ignoring operators' values outside the range (like ` Ring ` ), defining a function using the base set and applying that (like ` TopGrp ` ), or explicitly truncating the slot before use (like ` MetSp ` ). (Credit for this operator goes to Mario Carneiro.) See ~ ressbas for the altered base set, and ~ resslem ( ~ subrg0 , ~ ressplusg , ~ subrg1 , ~ ressmulr ) for the (un)altered other operations. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 29-Nov-2014.)

blocks.name: brstruct
blocks.content: The structure relation is a relation. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 29-Aug-2015.)

blocks.name: isstruct2
blocks.content: The property of being a structure with components in ` ( 1st `` X ) ... ( 2nd `` X ) ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 29-Aug-2015.)

blocks.origin:
thm isstruct(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wb(wbr(c0, cstr, cop(c1, c2)), w3a(w3a(wcel(c1, cn), wcel(c2, cn), wbr(c1, cle, c2)), wfun(cdif(c0, csn(emptycls))), wss(cdm(c0), co(c1, cfz, c2))))
} = {
  bitr4i(wbr(c0, cstr, cop(c1, c2)), w3a(w3a(wcel(c1, cn), wcel(c2, cn), wbr(c1, cle, c2)), wfun(cdif(c0, csn(emptycls))), wss(cdm(c0), co(c1, cfz, c2))), w3a(wcel(cop(c1, c2), cin(cle, cxp(cn, cn))), wfun(cdif(c0, csn(emptycls))), wss(cdm(c0), cfv(cfz, cop(c1, c2)))))
  isstruct2(c0, cop(c1, c2))
  3anbi123i(w3a(wcel(c1, cn), wcel(c2, cn), wbr(c1, cle, c2)), wfun(cdif(c0, csn(emptycls))), wss(cdm(c0), co(c1, cfz, c2)), wcel(cop(c1, c2), cin(cle, cxp(cn, cn))), wfun(cdif(c0, csn(emptycls))), wss(cdm(c0), cfv(cfz, cop(c1, c2))))
  3bitr2i(w3a(wcel(c1, cn), wcel(c2, cn), wbr(c1, cle, c2)), wcel(cop(c1, c2), cin(cle, cxp(cn, cn))), wa(wa(wcel(c1, cn), wcel(c2, cn)), wbr(c1, cle, c2)), wbr(c1, cin(cle, cxp(cn, cn)), c2))
  df-3an(wcel(c1, cn), wcel(c2, cn), wbr(c1, cle, c2))
  brinxp2(c1, cle, cn, cn, c2)
  df-br(c1, cin(cle, cxp(cn, cn)), c2)
  biid(wfun(cdif(c0, csn(emptycls))))
  sseq2i(cdm(c0), co(c1, cfz, c2), cfv(cfz, cop(c1, c2)))
  df-ov(c1, cfz, c2)
}

} = {

  3bitr2i((c1 ‚àà ‚Ñï ‚àß c2 ‚àà ‚Ñï ‚àß c1[‚â§]c2), < c1, c2 > ‚àà(‚â§ ‚ãÇ(‚Ñï √ó ‚Ñï)), ((c1 ‚àà ‚Ñï ‚àß c2 ‚àà ‚Ñï)‚àß c1[‚â§]c2), c1[(‚â§ ‚ãÇ(‚Ñï √ó ‚Ñï))]c2)

  ax-mp(wb(wceq(cin(ccnv(ccnv(c0)), csn(emptycls)), emptycls), wss(ccnv(ccnv(c0)), cdif(c0, csn(emptycls)))), wss(ccnv(ccnv(c0)), c0))
  cnvcnvss(c0)
  reldisj(ccnv(ccnv(c0)), c0, csn(emptycls))
  syl6eqssr(cdif(c0, csn(emptycls)), ccnv(ccnv(c0)), ccnv(ccnv(cdif(c0, csn(emptycls)))), wbr(c0, cstr, c1))
  sylib(wbr(c0, cstr, c1), wceq(ccnv(ccnv(cdif(c0, csn(emptycls)))), cdif(c0, csn(emptycls))), wrel(cdif(c0, csn(emptycls))))
  syl(wbr(c0, cstr, c1), wrel(cdif(c0, csn(emptycls))), wfun(cdif(c0, csn(emptycls))))

} = {
  pm3.2i(wfun(ccnv(ccnv(c0))), wss(cdm(c0), co(nat1, cfz, c1)))
  structfun(c0, cop(c2, c1))
  sstri(cdm(c0), co(nat1, cfz, c1), co(c2, cfz, c1))
  simp3i(wss(cdm(c0), co(c2, cfz, c1)), w3a(wcel(c2, cn), wcel(c1, cn), wbr(c2, cle, c1)), wfun(cdif(c0, csn(emptycls))))
  ax-mp(wss(co(c2, cfz, c1), co(nat1, cfz, c1)), wcel(c2, cfv(cuz, nat1)))
  mpbi(wcel(c2, cfv(cuz, nat1)), wcel(c2, cn))
  simp1i(wcel(c2, cn), wcel(c1, cn), wbr(c2, cle, c1))
  simp1i(w3a(wcel(c2, cn), wcel(c1, cn), wbr(c2, cle, c1)), wfun(cdif(c0, csn(emptycls))), wss(cdm(c0), co(c2, cfz, c1)))
  mpbi(w3a(w3a(wcel(c2, cn), wcel(c1, cn), wbr(c2, cle, c1)), wfun(cdif(c0, csn(emptycls))), wss(cdm(c0), co(c2, cfz, c1))), wbr(c0, cstr, cop(c2, c1)))
  isstruct(c0, c2, c1)
  elnnuz(c2)
  fzss1(c2, nat1, c1)
}

blocks.name: strfvn
blocks.content: Value of a structure component extractor ` E ` . Normally, ` E ` is a defined constant symbol such as ` Base ` ( ~ df-base ) and ` N ` is a fixed integer such as ` 1 ` . ` S ` is a structure, i.e. a specific member of a class of structures such as ` Poset ` ( ~ df-poset ) where ` S e. Poset ` . Note: Normally, this theorem shouldn't be used outside of this section, because it requires hard-coded index values. Instead, use ~ strfv . (Contributed by NM, 9-Sep-2011.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 6-Oct-2013.) (New usage is discouraged.)

blocks.name: strfvss
blocks.content: A structure component extractor produces a value which is contained in a set dependent on ` S ` , but not ` E ` . This is sometimes useful for showing sethood. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 15-Aug-2015.)

blocks.name: wunstr
blocks.content: Closure of a structure index in a weak universe. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 12-Jan-2017.)

blocks.name: ndxarg

} = {

  strfvn(c0, cnx, c1)
  eqeltri(cnx, universe, cres(cid, cn))
  ax-mp(wcel(cres(cid, cn), universe), wcel(cn, universe))
  nnex()
  resiexg(cn, universe)
  fveq1i(cnx, c1, cres(cid, cn))
  df-ndx()
  ax-mp(wceq(cfv(cres(cid, cn), c1), c1), wcel(c1, cn))
  fvresi(c1, cn)
}

} = {
  3eqtri((c0 ` ndx), c1, (ndx ` c1), ((= |` ‚Ñï)` c1))

  eqeltri(cnx, universe, (= |` ‚Ñï))

blocks.name: ndxid
blocks.content: A structure component extractor is defined by its own index. This theorem, together with ~ strfv below, is useful for avoiding direct reference to the hard-coded numeric index in component extractor definitions, such as the ` 1 ` in ~ df-base and the ` ; 1 0 ` in ~ df-ple , making it easier to change should the need arise. For example, we can refer to a specific poset with base set ` B ` and order relation ` L ` using ` { <. ( Base `` ndx ) , B >. , ` ` <. ( le `` ndx ) , L >. } ` rather than ` { <. 1 , B >. , ` ` <. ; 1 0 , L >. } ` . The latter, while shorter to state, requires revision if we later change ` ; 1 0 ` to some other number, and it may also be harder to remember. (Contributed by NM, 19-Oct-2012.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 6-Oct-2013.) (Proof shortened by BJ, 27-Dec-2021.)

blocks.content: The value of a structure component extractor is the value of the corresponding slot of the structure. (Contributed by AV, 13-Mar-2020.)

thm setsvalg(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3)), wceq(co(c0, csts, c2), cun(cres(c0, cdif(universe, cdm(csn(c2)))), csn(c2))))
} = {
  syl2an(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3), wceq(co(c0, csts, c2), cun(cres(c0, cdif(universe, cdm(csn(c2)))), csn(c2))), wcel(c0, universe), wcel(c2, universe))
  elex(c0, c1)
  elex(c2, c3)
  mpd3an3(wcel(c0, universe), wcel(c2, universe), wceq(co(c0, csts, c2), cun(cres(c0, cdif(universe, cdm(csn(c2)))), csn(c2))), wcel(cun(cres(c0, cdif(universe, cdm(csn(c2)))), csn(c2)), universe))
  sylancl(wa(wcel(c0, universe), wcel(c2, universe)), wcel(cun(cres(c0, cdif(universe, cdm(csn(c2)))), csn(c2)), universe), wcel(cres(c0, cdif(universe, cdm(csn(c2)))), universe), wcel(csn(c2), universe))
  adantr(wcel(c0, universe), wcel(c2, universe), wcel(cres(c0, cdif(universe, cdm(csn(c2)))), universe))
  resexg(c0, universe, cdif(universe, cdm(csn(c2))))
  snex(c2)
  unexg(cres(c0, cdif(universe, cdm(csn(c2)))), universe, csn(c2), universe)
  ovmpt2ga(hs0, hs1, c0, universe, c2, universe, cun(cres(c0, cdif(universe, cdm(csn(c2)))), csn(c2)), universe, csts, cun(cres(cv(hs0), cdif(universe, cdm(csn(cv(hs1))))), csn(cv(hs1))))
  uneq12d(cres(cv(hs0), cdif(universe, cdm(csn(cv(hs1))))), csn(cv(hs1)), cres(c0, cdif(universe, cdm(csn(c2)))), csn(c2), wa(wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wceq(cv(hs1), c2)))
  reseq12d(cv(hs0), cdif(universe, cdm(csn(cv(hs1)))), c0, cdif(universe, cdm(csn(c2))), wa(wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wceq(cv(hs1), c2)))
  simpl(wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wceq(cv(hs1), c2))
  difeq2d(universe, cdm(csn(cv(hs1))), cdm(csn(c2)), wa(wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wceq(cv(hs1), c2)))
  dmeqd(csn(cv(hs1)), csn(c2), wa(wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wceq(cv(hs1), c2)))
  sneqd(cv(hs1), c2, wa(wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wceq(cv(hs1), c2)))
  simpr(wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wceq(cv(hs1), c2))
  df-sets(hs0, hs1)
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(universe)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
  diff.hs0.c(cun(cres(c0, cdif(universe, cdm(csn(c2)))), csn(c2)))
  diff.hs1.c(c0)
  diff.hs1.c(universe)
  diff.hs1.c(c2)
  diff.hs1.c(cun(cres(c0, cdif(universe, cdm(csn(c2)))), csn(c2)))
}

thm setsvalg(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  ‚ä¢ ((c0 ‚àà c1 ‚àß c2 ‚àà c3)‚Üí(c0[sSet]c2)=((c0 |`(ùïå \ dom({ c2 })))‚ãÉ { c2 }))
} = {
  syl2an(c0 ‚àà c1, c2 ‚àà c3, (c0[sSet]c2)=((c0 |`(ùïå \ dom({ c2 })))‚ãÉ { c2 }), c0 ‚àà ùïå, c2 ‚àà ùïå)
  elex(c0, c1)
  elex(c2, c3)
  mpd3an3(c0 ‚àà ùïå, c2 ‚àà ùïå, (c0[sSet]c2)=((c0 |`(ùïå \ dom({ c2 })))‚ãÉ { c2 }), ((c0 |`(ùïå \ dom({ c2 })))‚ãÉ { c2 })‚àà ùïå)
  sylancl((c0 ‚àà ùïå ‚àß c2 ‚àà ùïå), ((c0 |`(ùïå \ dom({ c2 })))‚ãÉ { c2 })‚àà ùïå, (c0 |`(ùïå \ dom({ c2 })))‚àà ùïå, { c2 } ‚àà ùïå)
  adantr(c0 ‚àà ùïå, c2 ‚àà ùïå, (c0 |`(ùïå \ dom({ c2 })))‚àà ùïå)
  resexg(c0, universe, (ùïå \ dom({ c2 })))
  snex(c2)
  unexg((c0 |`(ùïå \ dom({ c2 }))), universe, { c2 }, universe)
  ovmpt2ga(hs0, hs1, c0, universe, c2, universe, ((c0 |`(ùïå \ dom({ c2 })))‚ãÉ { c2 }), universe, csts, ((hs0 |`(ùïå \ dom({ hs1 })))‚ãÉ { hs1 }))
  uneq12d((hs0 |`(ùïå \ dom({ hs1 }))), { hs1 }, (c0 |`(ùïå \ dom({ c2 }))), { c2 }, (hs0 = c0 ‚àß hs1 = c2))
  reseq12d(hs0, (ùïå \ dom({ hs1 })), c0, (ùïå \ dom({ c2 })), (hs0 = c0 ‚àß hs1 = c2))
  simpl(hs0 = c0, hs1 = c2)
  difeq2d(universe, dom({ hs1 }), dom({ c2 }), (hs0 = c0 ‚àß hs1 = c2))
  dmeqd({ hs1 }, { c2 }, (hs0 = c0 ‚àß hs1 = c2))
  sneqd(hs1, c2, (hs0 = c0 ‚àß hs1 = c2))
  simpr(hs0 = c0, hs1 = c2)
  df-sets(hs0, hs1)
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(universe)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
  diff.hs0.c(((c0 |`(ùïå \ dom({ c2 })))‚ãÉ { c2 }))
  diff.hs1.c(c0)
  diff.hs1.c(universe)
  diff.hs1.c(c2)
  diff.hs1.c(((c0 |`(ùïå \ dom({ c2 })))‚ãÉ { c2 }))
}

thm setsidvald(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wceq(c0, co(c0, csts, cop(cfv(c1, cnx), cfv(c1, c0)))))
  -| wceq(c1, cslot(c2))
  -| wcel(c2, cn)
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c0, c3))
  -| wi(w0, wfun(c0))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(cfv(c1, cnx), cdm(c0)))
} = {
  3eqtrrd(c0, co(c0, csts, cop(cfv(c1, cnx), cfv(c1, c0))), cun(cres(c0, cdif(universe, csn(cfv(c1, cnx)))), csn(cop(cfv(c1, cnx), cfv(c1, c0)))), cun(cres(c0, cdif(universe, csn(cfv(c1, cnx)))), csn(cop(cfv(c1, cnx), cfv(c0, cfv(c1, cnx))))), w0)
  sylancl(w0, wceq(co(c0, csts, cop(cfv(c1, cnx), cfv(c1, c0))), cun(cres(c0, cdif(universe, csn(cfv(c1, cnx)))), csn(cop(cfv(c1, cnx), cfv(c1, c0))))), wcel(c0, c3), wcel(cfv(c1, c0), universe))
  fvex(c1, c0)
  setsval(c0, c3, cfv(c1, c0), universe, cfv(c1, cnx))
  uneq2d(cres(c0, cdif(universe, csn(cfv(c1, cnx)))), csn(cop(cfv(c1, cnx), cfv(c1, c0))), csn(cop(cfv(c1, cnx), cfv(c0, cfv(c1, cnx)))), w0)
  sneqd(cop(cfv(c1, cnx), cfv(c1, c0)), cop(cfv(c1, cnx), cfv(c0, cfv(c1, cnx))), w0)
  opeq2d(cfv(c1, cnx), cfv(c1, c0), cfv(c0, cfv(c1, cnx)), w0)
  strfvnd(c1, c0, cfv(c1, cnx), c3, w0)
  ndxid(c1, c2)
  syl2anc(w0, wceq(cun(cres(c0, cdif(universe, csn(cfv(c1, cnx)))), csn(cop(cfv(c1, cnx), cfv(c0, cfv(c1, cnx))))), c0), wfun(c0), wcel(cfv(c1, cnx), cdm(c0)))
  funresdfunsn(c0, cfv(c1, cnx))
}

thm setsidvald(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, wff w0) {
  ‚ä¢ (w0 ‚Üí c0 =(c0[sSet]<(c1 ` ndx),(c1 ` c0)>))
  ‚ä£ c1 = Slot(c2)
  ‚ä£ c2 ‚àà ‚Ñï
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí c0 ‚àà c3)
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí Fun(c0))
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí(c1 ` ndx)‚àà dom(c0))
} = {
  3eqtrrd(c0, (c0[sSet]<(c1 ` ndx),(c1 ` c0)>), ((c0 |`(ùïå \ {(c1 ` ndx)}))‚ãÉ { <(c1 ` ndx),(c1 ` c0)> }), ((c0 |`(ùïå \ {(c1 ` ndx)}))‚ãÉ { <(c1 ` ndx),(c0 `(c1 ` ndx))> }), w0)
  sylancl(w0, (c0[sSet]<(c1 ` ndx),(c1 ` c0)>)=((c0 |`(ùïå \ {(c1 ` ndx)}))‚ãÉ { <(c1 ` ndx),(c1 ` c0)> }), c0 ‚àà c3, (c1 ` c0)‚àà ùïå)
  fvex(c1, c0)
  setsval(c0, c3, (c1 ` c0), universe, (c1 ` ndx))
  uneq2d((c0 |`(ùïå \ {(c1 ` ndx)})), { <(c1 ` ndx),(c1 ` c0)> }, { <(c1 ` ndx),(c0 `(c1 ` ndx))> }, w0)
  sneqd(<(c1 ` ndx),(c1 ` c0)>, <(c1 ` ndx),(c0 `(c1 ` ndx))>, w0)
  opeq2d((c1 ` ndx), (c1 ` c0), (c0 `(c1 ` ndx)), w0)
  strfvnd(c1, c0, (c1 ` ndx), c3, w0)
  ndxid(c1, c2)
  syl2anc(w0, ((c0 |`(ùïå \ {(c1 ` ndx)}))‚ãÉ { <(c1 ` ndx),(c0 `(c1 ` ndx))> })= c0, Fun(c0), (c1 ` ndx)‚àà dom(c0))
  funresdfunsn(c0, (c1 ` ndx))
}

thm fvsetsid(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5) {
  |- wi(w3a(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3), wcel(c4, c5)), wceq(cfv(co(c0, csts, cop(c2, c4)), c2), c4))
} = {
  eqtrd(cfv(co(c0, csts, cop(c2, c4)), c2), c4, cfv(cun(cres(c0, cdif(universe, csn(c2))), csn(cop(c2, c4))), c2), w3a(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3), wcel(c4, c5)))
  fveq1d(co(c0, csts, cop(c2, c4)), c2, cun(cres(c0, cdif(universe, csn(c2))), csn(cop(c2, c4))), w3a(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3), wcel(c4, c5)))
  3adant2(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3), wcel(c4, c5), wceq(co(c0, csts, cop(c2, c4)), cun(cres(c0, cdif(universe, csn(c2))), csn(cop(c2, c4)))))
  setsval(c0, c1, c4, c5, c2)
  syl3anc(w3a(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3), wcel(c4, c5)), wceq(cfv(cun(cres(c0, cdif(universe, csn(c2))), csn(cop(c2, c4))), c2), c4), wcel(c2, c3), wcel(c4, c5), wn(wcel(c2, cdm(cres(c0, cdif(universe, csn(c2)))))))
  simp2(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3), wcel(c4, c5))
  simp3(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3), wcel(c4, c5))
  a1i(w3a(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3), wcel(c4, c5)), wn(wcel(c2, cdm(cres(c0, cdif(universe, csn(c2)))))))
  mto(wcel(c2, cdm(cres(c0, cdif(universe, csn(c2))))), wcel(c2, cdif(universe, csn(c2))))
  neldifsn(c2, universe)
  sseli(c2, cdm(cres(c0, cdif(universe, csn(c2)))), cdif(universe, csn(c2)))
  eqsstri(cdm(cres(c0, cdif(universe, csn(c2)))), cdif(universe, csn(c2)), cin(cdif(universe, csn(c2)), cdm(c0)))
  dmres(c0, cdif(universe, csn(c2)))
  inss1(cdif(universe, csn(c2)), cdm(c0))
  fsnunfv(c2, c3, c4, c5, cres(c0, cdif(universe, csn(c2))))
}

  ‚ä¢ ((c0 ‚àà c1 ‚àß c2 ‚àà c3 ‚àß c4 ‚àà c5)‚Üí((c0[sSet]< c2, c4 >)` c2)= c4)

  setsval(c0, c1, c4, c5, c2)

thm fsets(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5) {
  |- wi(w3a(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wf(c0, c2, c3)), wcel(c4, c2), wcel(c5, c3)), wf(co(c0, csts, cop(c4, c5)), c2, c3))
} = {
  mpbird(w3a(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wf(c0, c2, c3)), wcel(c4, c2), wcel(c5, c3)), wf(co(c0, csts, cop(c4, c5)), c2, c3), wf(cun(cres(c0, cdif(universe, csn(c4))), csn(cop(c4, c5))), c2, c3))
  syl3an1(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wf(c0, c2, c3)), wcel(c4, c2), wcel(c5, c3), wf(cun(cres(c0, cdif(universe, csn(c4))), csn(cop(c4, c5))), c2, c3), wf(cres(c0, cdif(universe, csn(c4))), cdif(c2, csn(c4)), c3))
  adantl(wcel(c0, c1), wf(c0, c2, c3), wf(cres(c0, cdif(universe, csn(c4))), cdif(c2, csn(c4)), c3))
  mpbird(wf(c0, c2, c3), wf(cres(c0, cdif(universe, csn(c4))), cdif(c2, csn(c4)), c3), wf(cres(c0, cdif(c2, csn(c4))), cdif(c2, csn(c4)), c3))
  mpan2(wf(c0, c2, c3), wf(cres(c0, cdif(c2, csn(c4))), cdif(c2, csn(c4)), c3), wss(cdif(c2, csn(c4)), c2))
  difss(c2, csn(c4))
  fssres(c0, c2, c3, cdif(c2, csn(c4)))
  feq1d(cres(c0, cdif(universe, csn(c4))), cdif(c2, csn(c4)), c3, cres(c0, cdif(c2, csn(c4))), wf(c0, c2, c3))
  syl5reqr(cres(c0, cdif(universe, csn(c4))), cres(c0, cdif(c2, csn(c4))), cres(cres(c0, c2), cdif(universe, csn(c4))), wf(c0, c2, c3))
  eqtri(cres(cres(c0, c2), cdif(universe, csn(c4))), cres(c0, cdif(c2, csn(c4))), cres(c0, cin(c2, cdif(universe, csn(c4)))))
  resres(c0, c2, cdif(universe, csn(c4)))
  reseq2i(c0, cin(c2, cdif(universe, csn(c4))), cdif(c2, csn(c4)))
  invdif(c2, csn(c4))
  reseq1d(cres(c0, c2), cdif(universe, csn(c4)), c0, wf(c0, c2, c3))
  syl(wf(c0, c2, c3), wceq(cres(c0, c2), c0), wfn(c0, c2))
  ffn(c0, c2, c3)
  fnresdm(c0, c2)
  fsnunf2(cres(c0, cdif(universe, csn(c4))), c2, c4, c3, c5)
  syl2anc(w3a(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wf(c0, c2, c3)), wcel(c4, c2), wcel(c5, c3)), wb(wf(co(c0, csts, cop(c4, c5)), c2, c3), wf(cun(cres(c0, cdif(universe, csn(c4))), csn(cop(c4, c5))), c2, c3)), wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c5, c3))
  simp1l(wcel(c0, c1), wf(c0, c2, c3), wcel(c4, c2), wcel(c5, c3))
  simp3(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wf(c0, c2, c3)), wcel(c4, c2), wcel(c5, c3))
  feq1d(co(c0, csts, cop(c4, c5)), c2, c3, cun(cres(c0, cdif(universe, csn(c4))), csn(cop(c4, c5))), wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c5, c3)))
  setsval(c0, c1, c5, c3, c4)
}

  ‚ä¢ (((c0 ‚àà c1 ‚àß(c0 : c2 ‚Üí c3))‚àß c4 ‚àà c2 ‚àß c5 ‚àà c3)‚Üí((c0[sSet]< c4, c5 >): c2 ‚Üí c3))
} = {
  mpbird(((c0 ‚àà c1 ‚àß(c0 : c2 ‚Üí c3))‚àß c4 ‚àà c2 ‚àß c5 ‚àà c3), ((c0[sSet]< c4, c5 >): c2 ‚Üí c3), (((c0 |`(ùïå \ { c4 }))‚ãÉ { < c4, c5 > }): c2 ‚Üí c3))

thm strfv2d(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wceq(c0, cfv(c1, c2)))
  -| wceq(c1, cslot(cfv(c1, cnx)))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c2, c3))
  -| wi(w0, wfun(ccnv(ccnv(c2))))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(cop(cfv(c1, cnx), c0), c2))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c0, c4))
} = {
  eqtr2d(c0, cfv(c1, c2), cfv(c2, cfv(c1, cnx)), w0)
  strfvnd(c1, c2, cfv(c1, cnx), c3, w0)
  syl5eqr(cfv(c2, cfv(c1, cnx)), c0, cfv(ccnv(ccnv(c2)), cfv(c1, cnx)), w0)
  eqtri(cfv(ccnv(ccnv(c2)), cfv(c1, cnx)), cfv(c2, cfv(c1, cnx)), cfv(cres(c2, universe), cfv(c1, cnx)))
  fveq1i(ccnv(ccnv(c2)), cfv(c1, cnx), cres(c2, universe))
  cnvcnv2(c2)
  ax-mp(wceq(cfv(cres(c2, universe), cfv(c1, cnx)), cfv(c2, cfv(c1, cnx))), wcel(cfv(c1, cnx), universe))
  fvres(cfv(c1, cnx), universe, c2)
  sylc(w0, wceq(cfv(ccnv(ccnv(c2)), cfv(c1, cnx)), c0), wfun(ccnv(ccnv(c2))), wcel(cop(cfv(c1, cnx), c0), ccnv(ccnv(c2))))
  syl6eleqr(cop(cfv(c1, cnx), c0), ccnv(ccnv(c2)), cin(c2, cxp(universe, universe)), w0)
  elind(cop(cfv(c1, cnx), c0), c2, cxp(universe, universe), w0)
  sylancr(w0, wcel(cop(cfv(c1, cnx), c0), cxp(universe, universe)), wcel(cfv(c1, cnx), universe), wcel(c0, universe))
  fvex(c1, cnx)
  elexd(c0, c4, w0)
  opelxpi(cfv(c1, cnx), universe, c0, universe)
  cnvcnv(c2)
  funopfv(ccnv(ccnv(c2)), cfv(c1, cnx), c0)
}

  ‚ä¢ (w0 ‚Üí c0 =(c1 ` c2))

blocks.name: strfv2
blocks.content: A variation on ~ strfv to avoid asserting that ` S ` itself is a function, which involves sethood of all the ordered pair components of ` S ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 30-Apr-2015.)

blocks.name: strfv
blocks.content: Extract a structure component ` C ` (such as the base set) from a structure ` S ` (such as a member of ` Poset ` , ~ df-poset ) with a component extractor ` E ` (such as the base set extractor ~ df-base ). By virtue of ~ ndxid , this can be done without having to refer to the hard-coded numeric index of ` E ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 6-Oct-2013.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 29-Aug-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm strfv(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, c1), wceq(c0, cfv(c2, c3)))
  -| wbr(c3, cstr, c4)
  -| wceq(c2, cslot(cfv(c2, cnx)))
  -| wss(csn(cop(cfv(c2, cnx), c0)), c3)
} = {
  strfv2(c0, c1, c2, c3)
  ax-mp(wcel(c3, universe), wbr(c3, cstr, c4))
  structex(c3, c4)
  structfun(c3, c4)
  mpbir(wcel(cop(cfv(c2, cnx), c0), c3), wss(csn(cop(cfv(c2, cnx), c0)), c3))
  snss(cop(cfv(c2, cnx), c0), c3)
  opex(cfv(c2, cnx), c0)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm strfv(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4) {
  ‚ä¢ (c0 ‚àà c1 ‚Üí c0 =(c2 ` c3))
  ‚ä£ c3[Struct]c4
  ‚ä£ c2 = Slot((c2 ` ndx))
  ‚ä£ { <(c2 ` ndx), c0 > } ‚äÜ c3
} = {
  strfv2(c0, c1, c2, c3)
  ax-mp(c3 ‚àà ùïå, c3[Struct]c4)
  structex(c3, c4)
  structfun(c3, c4)
  mpbir(<(c2 ` ndx), c0 > ‚àà c3, { <(c2 ` ndx), c0 > } ‚äÜ c3)
  snss(<(c2 ` ndx), c0 >, c3)
  opex((c2 ` ndx), c0)
}

blocks.name: strfv3
blocks.content: Variant on ~ strfv for large structures. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 10-Jan-2017.)
blocks.origin:
thm strfv3(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wceq(c0, c1))
  -| wi(w0, wceq(c2, c3))
  -| wbr(c3, cstr, c4)
  -| wceq(c5, cslot(cfv(c5, cnx)))
  -| wss(csn(cop(cfv(c5, cnx), c1)), c3)
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c1, c6))
  -| wceq(c0, cfv(c5, c2))
} = {
  syl6reqr(c0, c1, cfv(c5, c2), w0)
  eqtr4d(c1, cfv(c5, c2), cfv(c5, c3), w0)
  syl(w0, wceq(c1, cfv(c5, c3)), wcel(c1, c6))
  strfv(c1, c6, c5, c3, c4)
  fveq2d(c5, c2, c3, w0)
}

thm strfv3(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, wff w0) {
  ‚ä¢ (w0 ‚Üí c0 = c1)
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí c2 = c3)
  ‚ä£ c3[Struct]c4
  ‚ä£ c5 = Slot((c5 ` ndx))
  ‚ä£ { <(c5 ` ndx), c1 > } ‚äÜ c3
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí c1 ‚àà c6)
  ‚ä£ c0 =(c5 ` c2)
} = {
  syl6reqr(c0, c1, (c5 ` c2), w0)
  eqtr4d(c1, (c5 ` c2), (c5 ` c3), w0)
  syl(w0, c1 =(c5 ` c3), c1 ‚àà c6)
  strfv(c1, c6, c5, c3, c4)
  fveq2d(c5, c2, c3, w0)
}

  -| wi(w0, wcel(cop(cfv(c0, cnx), c4), c2))
} = {

  ssexd(c2, c1, c3, w0)
  sylc(w0, wfun(c2), wss(c2, c1), wfun(c1))
  funss(c2, c1)
}

blocks.content: Value of the structure replacement function at an untouched index. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 1-Dec-2014.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 30-Apr-2015.)

thm setsnid(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  |- wceq(cfv(c0, c1), cfv(c0, co(c1, csts, cop(c2, c3))))
  -| wceq(c0, cslot(cfv(c0, cnx)))
  -| wne(cfv(c0, cnx), c2)
} = {
  pm2.61i(wceq(cfv(c0, c1), cfv(c0, co(c1, csts, cop(c2, c3)))), wcel(c1, universe))
  eqtr4d(cfv(c0, c1), cfv(c0, co(c1, csts, cop(c2, c3))), cfv(c1, cfv(c0, cnx)), wcel(c1, universe))
  strfvnd(c0, c1, cfv(c0, cnx), universe, wcel(c1, universe))
  id(wcel(c1, universe))
  syl5eq(cfv(c0, co(c1, csts, cop(c2, c3))), cfv(c1, cfv(c0, cnx)), cfv(co(c1, csts, cop(c2, c3)), cfv(c0, cnx)), wcel(c1, universe))
  strfvn(c0, co(c1, csts, cop(c2, c3)), cfv(c0, cnx))

  3eqtr3g(cfv(co(c1, csts, cop(c2, c3)), cfv(c0, cnx)), cfv(c1, cfv(c0, cnx)), cfv(cres(co(c1, csts, cop(c2, c3)), cdif(universe, csn(c2))), cfv(c0, cnx)), cfv(cres(c1, cdif(universe, csn(c2))), cfv(c0, cnx)), wcel(c1, universe))
  fveq1d(cres(co(c1, csts, cop(c2, c3)), cdif(universe, csn(c2))), cfv(c0, cnx), cres(c1, cdif(universe, csn(c2))), wcel(c1, universe))
  setsres(c1, universe, c2, c3)
  ax-mp(wceq(cfv(cres(co(c1, csts, cop(c2, c3)), cdif(universe, csn(c2))), cfv(c0, cnx)), cfv(co(c1, csts, cop(c2, c3)), cfv(c0, cnx))), wcel(cfv(c0, cnx), cdif(universe, csn(c2))))
  fvres(cfv(c0, cnx), cdif(universe, csn(c2)), co(c1, csts, cop(c2, c3)))
  ax-mp(wceq(cfv(cres(c1, cdif(universe, csn(c2))), cfv(c0, cnx)), cfv(c1, cfv(c0, cnx))), wcel(cfv(c0, cnx), cdif(universe, csn(c2))))
  mpbir2an(wcel(cfv(c0, cnx), cdif(universe, csn(c2))), wcel(cfv(c0, cnx), universe), wne(cfv(c0, cnx), c2))

thm setsnid(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  ‚ä¢ (c0 ` c1)=(c0 `(c1[sSet]< c2, c3 >))

} = {

  strfvnd(c0, c1, (c0 ` ndx), universe, c1 ‚àà ùïå)
  id(c1 ‚àà ùïå)

  strfvn(c0, (c1[sSet]< c2, c3 >), (c0 ` ndx))
  ovex(c1, csts, < c2, c3 >)
  3eqtr3g(((c1[sSet]< c2, c3 >)`(c0 ` ndx)), (c1 `(c0 ` ndx)), (((c1[sSet]< c2, c3 >)|`(ùïå \ { c2 }))`(c0 ` ndx)), ((c1 |`(ùïå \ { c2 }))`(c0 ` ndx)), c1 ‚àà ùïå)
  fveq1d(((c1[sSet]< c2, c3 >)|`(ùïå \ { c2 })), (c0 ` ndx), (c1 |`(ùïå \ { c2 })), c1 ‚àà ùïå)
  setsres(c1, universe, c2, c3)
  ax-mp((((c1[sSet]< c2, c3 >)|`(ùïå \ { c2 }))`(c0 ` ndx))=((c1[sSet]< c2, c3 >)`(c0 ` ndx)), (c0 ` ndx)‚àà(ùïå \ { c2 }))
  fvres((c0 ` ndx), (ùïå \ { c2 }), (c1[sSet]< c2, c3 >))
  ax-mp(((c1 |`(ùïå \ { c2 }))`(c0 ` ndx))=(c1 `(c0 ` ndx)), (c0 ` ndx)‚àà(ùïå \ { c2 }))
  mpbir2an((c0 ` ndx)‚àà(ùïå \ { c2 }), (c0 ` ndx)‚àà ùïå, (c0 ` ndx)‚â† c2)
  fvex(c0, cnx)

  reldmsets()
}

thm sbcie2s(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, wff w0, wff w1) {
  |- wi(wceq(cv(s0), c0), wb(wsbc(s1, cfv(c1, cv(s0)), wsbc(s2, cfv(c2, cv(s0)), w0)), w1))
  -| wceq(c3, cfv(c1, c0))

  -| diffsc(s1, c1)

  -| diffsw(s2, w1)
} = {

  eqtrd(cv(s1), c3, cfv(c1, cv(s0)), wa(wceq(cv(s0), c0), wa(wceq(cv(s1), cfv(c1, cv(s0))), wceq(cv(s2), cfv(c2, cv(s0))))))
  simprl(wceq(cv(s0), c0), wceq(cv(s1), cfv(c1, cv(s0))), wceq(cv(s2), cfv(c2, cv(s0))))
  adantr(wceq(cv(s0), c0), wa(wceq(cv(s1), cfv(c1, cv(s0))), wceq(cv(s2), cfv(c2, cv(s0)))), wceq(cfv(c1, cv(s0)), c3))
  syl6eqr(cfv(c1, cv(s0)), c3, cfv(c1, c0), wceq(cv(s0), c0))
  fveq2(cv(s0), c0, c1)
  eqtrd(cv(s2), c4, cfv(c2, cv(s0)), wa(wceq(cv(s0), c0), wa(wceq(cv(s1), cfv(c1, cv(s0))), wceq(cv(s2), cfv(c2, cv(s0))))))
  simprr(wceq(cv(s0), c0), wceq(cv(s1), cfv(c1, cv(s0))), wceq(cv(s2), cfv(c2, cv(s0))))
  adantr(wceq(cv(s0), c0), wa(wceq(cv(s1), cfv(c1, cv(s0))), wceq(cv(s2), cfv(c2, cv(s0)))), wceq(cfv(c2, cv(s0)), c4))
  syl6eqr(cfv(c2, cv(s0)), c4, cfv(c2, c0), wceq(cv(s0), c0))
  fveq2(cv(s0), c0, c2)
  diff.cfv.s(s1, c1, cv(s0))
  diff.cfv.s(s2, c1, cv(s0))
  diff.cfv.s(s2, c2, cv(s0))

blocks.name: baseval
blocks.content: Value of the base set extractor. (Normally it is preferred to work with ` ( Base `` ndx ) ` rather than the hard-coded ` 1 ` in order to make structure theorems portable. This is an example of how to obtain it when needed.) (New usage is discouraged.) (Contributed by NM, 4-Sep-2011.)

blocks.name: baseid
blocks.content: Utility theorem: index-independent form of ~ df-base . (Contributed by NM, 20-Oct-2012.)

blocks.name: elbasfv
blocks.content: Utility theorem: reverse closure for any structure defined as a function. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 24-Aug-2015.)

blocks.name: elbasov
blocks.content: Utility theorem: reverse closure for any structure defined as a two-argument function. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 3-Oct-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm elbasov(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, c1), wa(wcel(c2, universe), wcel(c3, universe)))
  -| wrel(cdm(c4))
  -| wceq(c5, co(c2, c4, c3))
  -| wceq(c1, cfv(cbs, c5))
} = {
  nsyl2(wcel(c0, c1), wa(wcel(c2, universe), wcel(c3, universe)), wceq(c1, emptycls))
  n0i(c0, c1)
  3eqtr4g(c1, emptycls, cfv(cbs, c5), cfv(cbs, emptycls), wn(wa(wcel(c2, universe), wcel(c3, universe))))
  fveq2d(cbs, c5, emptycls, wn(wa(wcel(c2, universe), wcel(c3, universe))))
  syl5eq(c5, emptycls, co(c2, c4, c3), wn(wa(wcel(c2, universe), wcel(c3, universe))))
  ovprc(c2, c3, c4)
  base0()
}

thm elbasov(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5) {
  ‚ä¢ (c0 ‚àà c1 ‚Üí(c2 ‚àà ùïå ‚àß c3 ‚àà ùïå))
  ‚ä£ Rel(dom(c4))
  ‚ä£ c5 =(c2[c4]c3)
  ‚ä£ c1 =(Base ` c5)
} = {
  nsyl2(c0 ‚àà c1, (c2 ‚àà ùïå ‚àß c3 ‚àà ùïå), c1 = ‚àÖ)
  n0i(c0, c1)
  3eqtr4g(c1, emptycls, (Base ` c5), (Base ` ‚àÖ), ¬¨(c2 ‚àà ùïå ‚àß c3 ‚àà ùïå))
  fveq2d(cbs, c5, emptycls, ¬¨(c2 ‚àà ùïå ‚àß c3 ‚àà ùïå))
  syl5eq(c5, emptycls, (c2[c4]c3), ¬¨(c2 ‚àà ùïå ‚àß c3 ‚àà ùïå))
  ovprc(c2, c3, c4)
  base0()
}

blocks.name: strov2rcl
blocks.content: Partial reverse closure for any structure defined as a two-argument function. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 27-Mar-2015.) (Proof shortened by AV, 2-Dec-2019.)

blocks.name: basendx
blocks.content: Index value of the base set extractor. (Normally it is preferred to work with ` ( Base `` ndx ) ` rather than the hard-coded ` 1 ` in order to make structure theorems portable. This is an example of how to obtain it when needed.) (New usage is discouraged.) (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 2-Aug-2013.)

blocks.name: basendxnn
blocks.content: The index value of the base set extractor is a positive integer. This property should be ensured for every concrete coding because otherwise it could not be used in an extensible structure (slots must be positive integers). (Contributed by AV, 23-Sep-2020.)

blocks.name: basprssdmsets
blocks.content: The pair of the base index and another index is a subset of the domain of the structure obtained by replacing/adding a slot at the other index in a structure having a base slot. (Contributed by AV, 7-Jun-2021.) (Revised by AV, 16-Nov-2021.)
blocks.origin:
thm basprssdmsets(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wss(cpr(cfv(cbs, cnx), c0), cdm(co(c1, csts, cop(c0, c2)))))
  -| wi(w0, wbr(c1, cstr, c3))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c0, c4))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c2, c5))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(cfv(cbs, cnx), cdm(c1)))
} = {
  sseqtr4d(cpr(cfv(cbs, cnx), c0), cdm(co(c1, csts, cop(c0, c2))), cun(cdm(c1), csn(c0)), w0)
  prssd(cfv(cbs, cnx), c0, cun(cdm(c1), csn(c0)), w0)
  sylibr(w0, wcel(cfv(cbs, cnx), cun(cdm(c1), csn(c0))), wo(wcel(cfv(cbs, cnx), cdm(c1)), wcel(cfv(cbs, cnx), csn(c0))))
  orcd(w0, wcel(cfv(cbs, cnx), cdm(c1)), wcel(cfv(cbs, cnx), csn(c0)))
  elun(cfv(cbs, cnx), cdm(c1), csn(c0))
  sylibr(w0, wcel(c0, cun(cdm(c1), csn(c0))), wo(wcel(c0, cdm(c1)), wcel(c0, csn(c0))))
  olcd(w0, wcel(c0, cdm(c1)), wcel(c0, csn(c0)))
  syl(w0, wcel(c0, csn(c0)), wcel(c0, c4))
  snidg(c0, c4)
  elun(c0, cdm(c1), csn(c0))
  syl2anc(w0, wceq(cdm(co(c1, csts, cop(c0, c2))), cun(cdm(c1), csn(c0))), wcel(c1, universe), wcel(c2, c5))
  syl(w0, wcel(c1, universe), wbr(c1, cstr, c3))
  structex(c1, c3)
  setsdm(c1, universe, c2, c5, c0)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm basprssdmsets(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, wff w0) {
  ‚ä¢ (w0 ‚Üí {(Base ` ndx), c0 } ‚äÜ dom((c1[sSet]< c0, c2 >)))
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí c1[Struct]c3)
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí c0 ‚àà c4)
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí c2 ‚àà c5)
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí(Base ` ndx)‚àà dom(c1))
} = {
  sseqtr4d({(Base ` ndx), c0 }, dom((c1[sSet]< c0, c2 >)), (dom(c1)‚ãÉ { c0 }), w0)
  prssd((Base ` ndx), c0, (dom(c1)‚ãÉ { c0 }), w0)
  sylibr(w0, (Base ` ndx)‚àà(dom(c1)‚ãÉ { c0 }), ((Base ` ndx)‚àà dom(c1)‚à®(Base ` ndx)‚àà { c0 }))
  orcd(w0, (Base ` ndx)‚àà dom(c1), (Base ` ndx)‚àà { c0 })
  elun((Base ` ndx), dom(c1), { c0 })
  sylibr(w0, c0 ‚àà(dom(c1)‚ãÉ { c0 }), (c0 ‚àà dom(c1)‚à® c0 ‚àà { c0 }))
  olcd(w0, c0 ‚àà dom(c1), c0 ‚àà { c0 })
  syl(w0, c0 ‚àà { c0 }, c0 ‚àà c4)
  snidg(c0, c4)
  elun(c0, dom(c1), { c0 })
  syl2anc(w0, dom((c1[sSet]< c0, c2 >))=(dom(c1)‚ãÉ { c0 }), c1 ‚àà ùïå, c2 ‚àà c5)

blocks.origin:
thm ressval(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3)), wceq(c4, cif(c0, co(c0, csts, cop(cfv(cbs, cnx), cin(c2, c5))), wss(c5, c2))))
  -| wceq(c4, co(c0, cress, c2))
  -| wceq(c5, cfv(cbs, c0))
} = {
  syl5eq(c4, cif(c0, co(c0, csts, cop(cfv(cbs, cnx), cin(c2, c5))), wss(c5, c2)), co(c0, cress, c2), wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3)))
  syl2an(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3), wceq(co(c0, cress, c2), cif(c0, co(c0, csts, cop(cfv(cbs, cnx), cin(c2, c5))), wss(c5, c2))), wcel(c0, universe), wcel(c2, universe))
  elex(c0, c1)
  elex(c2, c3)
  mpd3an3(wcel(c0, universe), wcel(c2, universe), wceq(co(c0, cress, c2), cif(c0, co(c0, csts, cop(cfv(cbs, cnx), cin(c2, c5))), wss(c5, c2))), wcel(cif(c0, co(c0, csts, cop(cfv(cbs, cnx), cin(c2, c5))), wss(c5, c2)), universe))
  sylancl(wa(wcel(c0, universe), wcel(c2, universe)), wcel(cif(c0, co(c0, csts, cop(cfv(cbs, cnx), cin(c2, c5))), wss(c5, c2)), universe), wcel(c0, universe), wcel(co(c0, csts, cop(cfv(cbs, cnx), cin(c2, c5))), universe))
  simpl(wcel(c0, universe), wcel(c2, universe))
  ovex(c0, csts, cop(cfv(cbs, cnx), cin(c2, c5)))
  ifcl(c0, universe, co(c0, csts, cop(cfv(cbs, cnx), cin(c2, c5))), wss(c5, c2))
  ovmpt2ga(hs0, hs1, c0, universe, c2, universe, cif(c0, co(c0, csts, cop(cfv(cbs, cnx), cin(c2, c5))), wss(c5, c2)), universe, cress, cif(cv(hs0), co(cv(hs0), csts, cop(cfv(cbs, cnx), cin(cv(hs1), cfv(cbs, cv(hs0))))), wss(cfv(cbs, cv(hs0)), cv(hs1))))
  ifbieq12d(cv(hs0), co(cv(hs0), csts, cop(cfv(cbs, cnx), cin(cv(hs1), cfv(cbs, cv(hs0))))), c0, co(c0, csts, cop(cfv(cbs, cnx), cin(c2, c5))), wa(wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wceq(cv(hs1), c2)), wss(cfv(cbs, cv(hs0)), cv(hs1)), wss(c5, c2))
  sseq12d(cfv(cbs, cv(hs0)), cv(hs1), c5, c2, wa(wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wceq(cv(hs1), c2)))
  oveq12d(cv(hs0), csts, cop(cfv(cbs, cnx), cin(cv(hs1), cfv(cbs, cv(hs0)))), c0, cop(cfv(cbs, cnx), cin(c2, c5)), wa(wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wceq(cv(hs1), c2)))
  opeq2d(cfv(cbs, cnx), cin(cv(hs1), cfv(cbs, cv(hs0))), cin(c2, c5), wa(wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wceq(cv(hs1), c2)))
  ineq12d(cv(hs1), cfv(cbs, cv(hs0)), c2, c5, wa(wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wceq(cv(hs1), c2)))
  simpr(wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wceq(cv(hs1), c2))
  syl6eqr(cfv(cbs, cv(hs0)), c5, cfv(cbs, c0), wa(wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wceq(cv(hs1), c2)))
  fveq2d(cbs, cv(hs0), c0, wa(wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wceq(cv(hs1), c2)))
  simpl(wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wceq(cv(hs1), c2))
  df-ress(hs0, hs1)
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(universe)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
  diff.hs0.c(cif(c0, co(c0, csts, cop(cfv(cbs, cnx), cin(c2, c5))), wss(c5, c2)))
  diff.hs1.c(c0)
  diff.hs1.c(universe)
  diff.hs1.c(c2)
  diff.hs1.c(cif(c0, co(c0, csts, cop(cfv(cbs, cnx), cin(c2, c5))), wss(c5, c2)))
}

thm ressval(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5) {
  ‚ä¢ ((c0 ‚àà c1 ‚àß c2 ‚àà c3)‚Üí c4 = if(c5 ‚äÜ c2, c0,(c0[sSet]<(Base ` ndx),(c2 ‚ãÇ c5)>)))

  ifbieq12d(hs0, (hs0[sSet]<(Base ` ndx),(hs1 ‚ãÇ(Base ` hs0))>), c0, (c0[sSet]<(Base ` ndx),(c2 ‚ãÇ c5)>), (hs0 = c0 ‚àß hs1 = c2), (Base ` hs0)‚äÜ hs1, c5 ‚äÜ c2)

  oveq12d(hs0, csts, <(Base ` ndx),(hs1 ‚ãÇ(Base ` hs0))>, c0, <(Base ` ndx),(c2 ‚ãÇ c5)>, (hs0 = c0 ‚àß hs1 = c2))

thm ressbas(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4) {

  pm2.61i(wi(wa(wcel(c4, universe), wcel(c0, c1)), wceq(cin(c0, c2), cfv(cbs, c3))), wss(c2, c0))
  3expib(wss(c2, c0), wcel(c4, universe), wcel(c0, c1), wceq(cin(c0, c2), cfv(cbs, c3)))

  sseqin2(c2, c0)

  oveq2i(c2, csts, <(Base ` ndx),(c0 ‚ãÇ c3)>, <(Base ` ndx),((c0 ‚ãÇ c3)‚ãÇ c3)>)
  opeq2i((Base ` ndx), (c0 ‚ãÇ c3), ((c0 ‚ãÇ c3)‚ãÇ c3))
  eqtr2i((c0 ‚ãÇ c3), ((c0 ‚ãÇ c3)‚ãÇ c3), (c0 ‚ãÇ(c3 ‚ãÇ c3)))
  inass(c0, c3, c3)
  ineq2i(c0, (c3 ‚ãÇ c3), c3)
  inidm(c3)
  ressval2(c3, c0, c2, universe, universe, (c2[|`s]c0))
  eqid((c2[|`s]c0))
  syl3an(¬¨ c3 ‚äÜ c0, c2 ‚àà ùïå, c0 ‚àà ùïå, (c2[|`s](c0 ‚ãÇ c3))=(c2[sSet]<(Base ` ndx),((c0 ‚ãÇ c3)‚ãÇ c3)>), ¬¨ c3 ‚äÜ(c0 ‚ãÇ c3), c2 ‚àà ùïå, (c0 ‚ãÇ c3)‚àà ùïå)
  con3i(c3 ‚äÜ c0, c3 ‚äÜ(c0 ‚ãÇ c3))
  mpan2(c3 ‚äÜ(c0 ‚ãÇ c3), c3 ‚äÜ c0, (c0 ‚ãÇ c3)‚äÜ c0)
  inss1(c0, c3)
  sstr(c3, (c0 ‚ãÇ c3), c0)
  elex(c2, universe)
  inex1g(c0, universe, c3)
  ressval2(c3, (c0 ‚ãÇ c3), c2, universe, universe, (c2[|`s](c0 ‚ãÇ c3)))
  eqid((c2[|`s](c0 ‚ãÇ c3)))
  adantr(¬¨ c2 ‚àà ùïå, c0 ‚àà ùïå, (c2[|`s]c0)=(c2[|`s](c0 ‚ãÇ c3)))
  eqtr4d((c2[|`s]c0), (c2[|`s](c0 ‚ãÇ c3)), emptycls, ¬¨ c2 ‚àà ùïå)
  ovprc1(c2, cress, c0)
  ovprc1(c2, cress, (c0 ‚ãÇ c3))
  reldmress()
}

blocks.name: ressval3d
blocks.content: Value of structure restriction, deduction version. (Contributed by AV, 14-Mar-2020.) (Revised by AV, 3-Jul-2022.)
blocks.origin:
thm ressval3d(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wceq(c0, co(c1, csts, cop(c2, c3))))
  -| wceq(c0, co(c1, cress, c3))
  -| wceq(c4, cfv(cbs, c1))
  -| wceq(c2, cfv(cbs, cnx))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c1, c5))
  -| wi(w0, wfun(c1))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c2, cdm(c1)))
  -| wi(w0, wss(c3, c4))
} = {
  mpcom(w0, wceq(c0, co(c1, csts, cop(c2, c3))), wss(c3, c4))
  sylbi(wss(c3, c4), wi(w0, wceq(c0, co(c1, csts, cop(c2, c3)))), wo(wa(wss(c3, c4), wn(wss(c4, c3))), wceq(c3, c4)))
  bitri(wss(c3, c4), wo(wa(wss(c3, c4), wn(wss(c4, c3))), wceq(c3, c4)), wo(wpss(c3, c4), wceq(c3, c4)))
  sspss(c3, c4)
  orbi1i(wpss(c3, c4), wceq(c3, c4), wa(wss(c3, c4), wn(wss(c4, c3))))
  dfpss3(c3, c4)
  jaoi(wa(wss(c3, c4), wn(wss(c4, c3))), wceq(c3, c4), wi(w0, wceq(c0, co(c1, csts, cop(c2, c3)))))
  ex(wa(wss(c3, c4), wn(wss(c4, c3))), w0, wceq(c0, co(c1, csts, cop(c2, c3))))
  eqtrd(c0, co(c1, csts, cop(c2, c3)), co(c1, csts, cop(cfv(cbs, cnx), cin(c3, c4))), wa(wa(wss(c3, c4), wn(wss(c4, c3))), w0))
  syl3anc(wa(wa(wss(c3, c4), wn(wss(c4, c3))), w0), wceq(c0, co(c1, csts, cop(cfv(cbs, cnx), cin(c3, c4)))), wn(wss(c4, c3)), wcel(c1, c5), wcel(c3, universe))
  simplr(wss(c3, c4), wn(wss(c4, c3)), w0)
  adantl(wa(wss(c3, c4), wn(wss(c4, c3))), w0, wcel(c1, c5))
  syl2an(wa(wss(c3, c4), wn(wss(c4, c3))), w0, wcel(c3, universe), wss(c3, c4), wcel(c4, universe))
  simpl(wss(c3, c4), wn(wss(c4, c3)))
  a1i(w0, wcel(c4, universe))
  fvexi(c4, cbs, c1)
  ssexg(c3, c4, universe)
  ressval2(c4, c3, c1, c5, universe, c0)
  oveq2d(c1, csts, cop(cfv(cbs, cnx), cin(c3, c4)), cop(c2, c3), wa(wa(wss(c3, c4), wn(wss(c4, c3))), w0))
  eqcomd(cop(cfv(cbs, cnx), cin(c3, c4)), cop(c2, c3), wa(wa(wss(c3, c4), wn(wss(c4, c3))), w0))
  opeq12d(c2, c3, cfv(cbs, cnx), cin(c3, c4), wa(wa(wss(c3, c4), wn(wss(c4, c3))), w0))
  a1i(wa(wa(wss(c3, c4), wn(wss(c4, c3))), w0), wceq(c2, cfv(cbs, cnx)))
  adantr(wa(wss(c3, c4), wn(wss(c4, c3))), w0, wceq(c3, cin(c3, c4)))
  adantr(wss(c3, c4), wn(wss(c4, c3)), wceq(c3, cin(c3, c4)))
  eqcomd(c3, cin(c3, c4), wss(c3, c4))
  biimpi(wss(c3, c4), wceq(cin(c3, c4), c3))
  df-ss(c3, c4)
  ex(wceq(c3, c4), w0, wceq(c0, co(c1, csts, cop(c2, c3))))
  3eqtrd(c0, co(c1, csts, cop(c2, c3)), c1, co(c1, csts, cop(cfv(cbs, cnx), cfv(cbs, c1))), wa(wceq(c3, c4), w0))
  3eqtrd(c0, c1, co(c1, cress, c3), co(c1, cress, c4), wa(wceq(c3, c4), w0))
  a1i(wa(wceq(c3, c4), w0), wceq(c0, co(c1, cress, c3)))
  adantr(wceq(c3, c4), w0, wceq(co(c1, cress, c3), co(c1, cress, c4)))
  oveq2(c3, c4, c1, cress)
  syl(wa(wceq(c3, c4), w0), wceq(co(c1, cress, c4), c1), wcel(c1, c5))
  adantl(wceq(c3, c4), w0, wcel(c1, c5))
  ressid(c1, c5, c4)
  adantl(wceq(c3, c4), w0, wceq(c1, co(c1, csts, cop(cfv(cbs, cnx), cfv(cbs, c1)))))
  setsidvald(c1, cbs, nat1, c5, w0)
  df-base()
  1nn()
  syl5eqelr(cfv(cbs, cnx), cdm(c1), c2, w0)
  oveq2d(c1, csts, cop(cfv(cbs, cnx), cfv(cbs, c1)), cop(c2, c3), wa(wceq(c3, c4), w0))
  eqcomd(cop(cfv(cbs, cnx), cfv(cbs, c1)), cop(c2, c3), wa(wceq(c3, c4), w0))
  opeq12d(c2, c3, cfv(cbs, cnx), cfv(cbs, c1), wa(wceq(c3, c4), w0))
  a1i(wa(wceq(c3, c4), w0), wceq(c2, cfv(cbs, cnx)))
  syl6eq(c3, cfv(cbs, c1), c4, wa(wceq(c3, c4), w0))
  simpl(wceq(c3, c4), w0)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm ressval3d(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, wff w0) {
  ‚ä¢ (w0 ‚Üí c0 =(c1[sSet]< c2, c3 >))
  ‚ä£ c0 =(c1[|`s]c3)
  ‚ä£ c4 =(Base ` c1)
  ‚ä£ c2 =(Base ` ndx)
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí c1 ‚àà c5)
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí Fun(c1))
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí c2 ‚àà dom(c1))
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí c3 ‚äÜ c4)
} = {
  mpcom(w0, c0 =(c1[sSet]< c2, c3 >), c3 ‚äÜ c4)
  sylbi(c3 ‚äÜ c4, (w0 ‚Üí c0 =(c1[sSet]< c2, c3 >)), ((c3 ‚äÜ c4 ‚àß ¬¨ c4 ‚äÜ c3)‚à® c3 = c4))
  bitri(c3 ‚äÜ c4, ((c3 ‚äÜ c4 ‚àß ¬¨ c4 ‚äÜ c3)‚à® c3 = c4), (c3 ‚ää c4 ‚à® c3 = c4))
  sspss(c3, c4)
  orbi1i(c3 ‚ää c4, c3 = c4, (c3 ‚äÜ c4 ‚àß ¬¨ c4 ‚äÜ c3))
  dfpss3(c3, c4)
  jaoi((c3 ‚äÜ c4 ‚àß ¬¨ c4 ‚äÜ c3), c3 = c4, (w0 ‚Üí c0 =(c1[sSet]< c2, c3 >)))
  ex((c3 ‚äÜ c4 ‚àß ¬¨ c4 ‚äÜ c3), w0, c0 =(c1[sSet]< c2, c3 >))
  eqtrd(c0, (c1[sSet]< c2, c3 >), (c1[sSet]<(Base ` ndx),(c3 ‚ãÇ c4)>), ((c3 ‚äÜ c4 ‚àß ¬¨ c4 ‚äÜ c3)‚àß w0))
  syl3anc(((c3 ‚äÜ c4 ‚àß ¬¨ c4 ‚äÜ c3)‚àß w0), c0 =(c1[sSet]<(Base ` ndx),(c3 ‚ãÇ c4)>), ¬¨ c4 ‚äÜ c3, c1 ‚àà c5, c3 ‚àà ùïå)
  simplr(c3 ‚äÜ c4, ¬¨ c4 ‚äÜ c3, w0)
  adantl((c3 ‚äÜ c4 ‚àß ¬¨ c4 ‚äÜ c3), w0, c1 ‚àà c5)
  syl2an((c3 ‚äÜ c4 ‚àß ¬¨ c4 ‚äÜ c3), w0, c3 ‚àà ùïå, c3 ‚äÜ c4, c4 ‚àà ùïå)
  simpl(c3 ‚äÜ c4, ¬¨ c4 ‚äÜ c3)
  a1i(w0, c4 ‚àà ùïå)
  fvexi(c4, cbs, c1)
  ssexg(c3, c4, universe)
  ressval2(c4, c3, c1, c5, universe, c0)
  oveq2d(c1, csts, <(Base ` ndx),(c3 ‚ãÇ c4)>, < c2, c3 >, ((c3 ‚äÜ c4 ‚àß ¬¨ c4 ‚äÜ c3)‚àß w0))
  eqcomd(<(Base ` ndx),(c3 ‚ãÇ c4)>, < c2, c3 >, ((c3 ‚äÜ c4 ‚àß ¬¨ c4 ‚äÜ c3)‚àß w0))
  opeq12d(c2, c3, (Base ` ndx), (c3 ‚ãÇ c4), ((c3 ‚äÜ c4 ‚àß ¬¨ c4 ‚äÜ c3)‚àß w0))
  a1i(((c3 ‚äÜ c4 ‚àß ¬¨ c4 ‚äÜ c3)‚àß w0), c2 =(Base ` ndx))
  adantr((c3 ‚äÜ c4 ‚àß ¬¨ c4 ‚äÜ c3), w0, c3 =(c3 ‚ãÇ c4))
  adantr(c3 ‚äÜ c4, ¬¨ c4 ‚äÜ c3, c3 =(c3 ‚ãÇ c4))
  eqcomd(c3, (c3 ‚ãÇ c4), c3 ‚äÜ c4)
  biimpi(c3 ‚äÜ c4, (c3 ‚ãÇ c4)= c3)
  df-ss(c3, c4)
  ex(c3 = c4, w0, c0 =(c1[sSet]< c2, c3 >))
  3eqtrd(c0, (c1[sSet]< c2, c3 >), c1, (c1[sSet]<(Base ` ndx),(Base ` c1)>), (c3 = c4 ‚àß w0))
  3eqtrd(c0, c1, (c1[|`s]c3), (c1[|`s]c4), (c3 = c4 ‚àß w0))
  a1i((c3 = c4 ‚àß w0), c0 =(c1[|`s]c3))
  adantr(c3 = c4, w0, (c1[|`s]c3)=(c1[|`s]c4))
  oveq2(c3, c4, c1, cress)
  syl((c3 = c4 ‚àß w0), (c1[|`s]c4)= c1, c1 ‚àà c5)
  adantl(c3 = c4, w0, c1 ‚àà c5)
  ressid(c1, c5, c4)
  adantl(c3 = c4, w0, c1 =(c1[sSet]<(Base ` ndx),(Base ` c1)>))
  setsidvald(c1, cbs, nat1, c5, w0)
  df-base()
  1nn()
  syl5eqelr((Base ` ndx), dom(c1), c2, w0)
  oveq2d(c1, csts, <(Base ` ndx),(Base ` c1)>, < c2, c3 >, (c3 = c4 ‚àß w0))
  eqcomd(<(Base ` ndx),(Base ` c1)>, < c2, c3 >, (c3 = c4 ‚àß w0))
  opeq12d(c2, c3, (Base ` ndx), (Base ` c1), (c3 = c4 ‚àß w0))
  a1i((c3 = c4 ‚àß w0), c2 =(Base ` ndx))
  syl6eq(c3, (Base ` c1), c4, (c3 = c4 ‚àß w0))
  simpl(c3 = c4, w0)
}

blocks.name: ressress

thm ressress(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4) {

} = {
  pm2.61i(wi(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3)), wceq(co(co(c4, cress, c0), cress, c2), co(c4, cress, cin(c0, c2)))), wcel(c4, universe))
  3expib(wcel(c4, universe), wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3), wceq(co(co(c4, cress, c0), cress, c2), co(c4, cress, cin(c0, c2))))
  pm2.61ii(wi(w3a(wcel(c4, universe), wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3)), wceq(co(co(c4, cress, c0), cress, c2), co(c4, cress, cin(c0, c2)))), wss(cfv(cbs, co(c4, cress, c0)), c2), wss(cfv(cbs, c4), c0))
  exp31(wn(wss(cfv(cbs, co(c4, cress, c0)), c2)), wn(wss(cfv(cbs, c4), c0)), w3a(wcel(c4, universe), wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3)), wceq(co(co(c4, cress, c0), cress, c2), co(c4, cress, cin(c0, c2))))
  3eqtr4d(co(co(c4, cress, c0), cress, c2), co(c4, cress, cin(c0, c2)), co(co(c4, cress, c0), csts, cop(cfv(cbs, cnx), cin(c2, cfv(cbs, co(c4, cress, c0))))), co(c4, csts, cop(cfv(cbs, cnx), cin(cin(c0, c2), cfv(cbs, c4)))), wa(wa(wn(wss(cfv(cbs, co(c4, cress, c0)), c2)), wn(wss(cfv(cbs, c4), c0))), w3a(wcel(c4, universe), wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3))))

  oveq12d(co(c4, cress, c0), csts, cop(cfv(cbs, cnx), cin(c2, cfv(cbs, co(c4, cress, c0)))), co(c4, csts, cop(cfv(cbs, cnx), cin(c0, cfv(cbs, c4)))), cop(cfv(cbs, cnx), cin(cin(c0, c2), cfv(cbs, c4))), wa(wa(wn(wss(cfv(cbs, co(c4, cress, c0)), c2)), wn(wss(cfv(cbs, c4), c0))), w3a(wcel(c4, universe), wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3))))
  syl3anc(wa(wa(wn(wss(cfv(cbs, co(c4, cress, c0)), c2)), wn(wss(cfv(cbs, c4), c0))), w3a(wcel(c4, universe), wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3))), wceq(co(c4, cress, c0), co(c4, csts, cop(cfv(cbs, cnx), cin(c0, cfv(cbs, c4))))), wn(wss(cfv(cbs, c4), c0)), wcel(c4, universe), wcel(c0, c1))
  ressval2(cfv(cbs, c4), c0, c4, universe, c1, co(c4, cress, c0))
  opeq2d(cfv(cbs, cnx), cin(c2, cfv(cbs, co(c4, cress, c0))), cin(cin(c0, c2), cfv(cbs, c4)), wa(wa(wn(wss(cfv(cbs, co(c4, cress, c0)), c2)), wn(wss(cfv(cbs, c4), c0))), w3a(wcel(c4, universe), wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3))))
  syl5req(cin(c2, cfv(cbs, co(c4, cress, c0))), cin(cin(c0, c2), cfv(cbs, c4)), cin(c2, cin(c0, cfv(cbs, c4))), wa(wa(wn(wss(cfv(cbs, co(c4, cress, c0)), c2)), wn(wss(cfv(cbs, c4), c0))), w3a(wcel(c4, universe), wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3))))

  syl(wa(wa(wn(wss(cfv(cbs, co(c4, cress, c0)), c2)), wn(wss(cfv(cbs, c4), c0))), w3a(wcel(c4, universe), wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3))), wceq(cin(c0, cfv(cbs, c4)), cfv(cbs, co(c4, cress, c0))), wcel(c0, c1))
  sylancl(wa(wa(wn(wss(cfv(cbs, co(c4, cress, c0)), c2)), wn(wss(cfv(cbs, c4), c0))), w3a(wcel(c4, universe), wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3))), wceq(co(co(c4, csts, cop(cfv(cbs, cnx), cin(c0, cfv(cbs, c4)))), csts, cop(cfv(cbs, cnx), cin(cin(c0, c2), cfv(cbs, c4)))), co(c4, csts, cop(cfv(cbs, cnx), cin(cin(c0, c2), cfv(cbs, c4))))), wcel(c4, universe), wcel(cin(cin(c0, c2), cfv(cbs, c4)), universe))
  inex2(cin(c0, c2), cfv(cbs, c4))
  fvex(cbs, c4)
  setsabs(c4, universe, cin(cin(c0, c2), cfv(cbs, c4)), universe, cfv(cbs, cnx), cin(c0, cfv(cbs, c4)))
  syl3anc(wa(wa(wn(wss(cfv(cbs, co(c4, cress, c0)), c2)), wn(wss(cfv(cbs, c4), c0))), w3a(wcel(c4, universe), wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3))), wceq(co(co(c4, cress, c0), cress, c2), co(co(c4, cress, c0), csts, cop(cfv(cbs, cnx), cin(c2, cfv(cbs, co(c4, cress, c0)))))), wn(wss(cfv(cbs, co(c4, cress, c0)), c2)), wcel(co(c4, cress, c0), universe), wcel(c2, c3))
  simpll(wn(wss(cfv(cbs, co(c4, cress, c0)), c2)), wn(wss(cfv(cbs, c4), c0)), w3a(wcel(c4, universe), wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3)))
  ovexd(c4, cress, c0, wa(wa(wn(wss(cfv(cbs, co(c4, cress, c0)), c2)), wn(wss(cfv(cbs, c4), c0))), w3a(wcel(c4, universe), wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3))))

blocks.name: wunress
blocks.content: Closure of structure restriction in a weak universe. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 12-Jan-2017.)
blocks.origin:
thm wunress(class c0, class c1, class c2, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wcel(co(c0, cress, c1), c2))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c2, cwun))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(com, c2))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c0, c2))
} = {
  pm2.61d(w0, wcel(co(c0, cress, c1), c2), wcel(c1, universe))
  ex(w0, wcel(c1, universe), wcel(co(c0, cress, c1), c2))
  eqeltrd(co(c0, cress, c1), c2, cif(c0, co(c0, csts, cop(cfv(cbs, cnx), cin(c1, cfv(cbs, c0)))), wss(cfv(cbs, c0), c1)), wa(w0, wcel(c1, universe)))
  sylan(w0, wcel(c1, universe), wceq(co(c0, cress, c1), cif(c0, co(c0, csts, cop(cfv(cbs, cnx), cin(c1, cfv(cbs, c0)))), wss(cfv(cbs, c0), c1))), wcel(c0, c2))
  ressval(c0, c2, c1, universe, co(c0, cress, c1), cfv(cbs, c0))
  eqid(co(c0, cress, c1))
  eqid(cfv(cbs, c0))
  adantr(w0, wcel(c1, universe), wcel(cif(c0, co(c0, csts, cop(cfv(cbs, cnx), cin(c1, cfv(cbs, c0)))), wss(cfv(cbs, c0), c1)), c2))
  ifcld(c0, co(c0, csts, cop(cfv(cbs, cnx), cin(c1, cfv(cbs, c0)))), c2, w0, wss(cfv(cbs, c0), c1))
  wunsets(c0, cop(cfv(cbs, cnx), cin(c1, cfv(cbs, c0))), c2, w0)
  wunop(cfv(cbs, cnx), cin(c1, cfv(cbs, c0)), c2, w0)
  wunstr(cbs, cnx, c2, nat1, w0)
  wunndx(c2, w0)
  syl5eqel(cin(c1, cfv(cbs, c0)), c2, cin(cfv(cbs, c0), c1), w0)
  incom(c1, cfv(cbs, c0))
  wunin(cfv(cbs, c0), c1, c2, w0)
  wunstr(cbs, c0, c2, nat1, w0)
  df-base()
  syl5ibrcom(w0, wn(wcel(c1, universe)), wcel(co(c0, cress, c1), c2), wcel(emptycls, c2))
  wun0(c2, w0)
  eleq1d(co(c0, cress, c1), c2, emptycls, wn(wcel(c1, universe)))
  ovprc2(c1, c0, cress)
  reldmress()
}

thm wunress(class c0, class c1, class c2, wff w0) {
  ‚ä¢ (w0 ‚Üí(c0[|`s]c1)‚àà c2)
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí c2 ‚àà WUni)
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí _om ‚àà c2)
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí c0 ‚àà c2)
} = {
  pm2.61d(w0, (c0[|`s]c1)‚àà c2, c1 ‚àà ùïå)
  ex(w0, c1 ‚àà ùïå, (c0[|`s]c1)‚àà c2)
  eqeltrd((c0[|`s]c1), c2, if((Base ` c0)‚äÜ c1, c0,(c0[sSet]<(Base ` ndx),(c1 ‚ãÇ(Base ` c0))>)), (w0 ‚àß c1 ‚àà ùïå))

  ressval(c0, c2, c1, universe, (c0[|`s]c1), (Base ` c0))
  eqid((c0[|`s]c1))
  eqid((Base ` c0))
  adantr(w0, c1 ‚àà ùïå, if((Base ` c0)‚äÜ c1, c0,(c0[sSet]<(Base ` ndx),(c1 ‚ãÇ(Base ` c0))>))‚àà c2)
  ifcld(c0, (c0[sSet]<(Base ` ndx),(c1 ‚ãÇ(Base ` c0))>), c2, w0, (Base ` c0)‚äÜ c1)
  wunsets(c0, <(Base ` ndx),(c1 ‚ãÇ(Base ` c0))>, c2, w0)
  wunop((Base ` ndx), (c1 ‚ãÇ(Base ` c0)), c2, w0)
  wunstr(cbs, cnx, c2, nat1, w0)
  wunndx(c2, w0)
  syl5eqel((c1 ‚ãÇ(Base ` c0)), c2, ((Base ` c0)‚ãÇ c1), w0)
  incom(c1, (Base ` c0))
  wunin((Base ` c0), c1, c2, w0)
  wunstr(cbs, c0, c2, nat1, w0)
  df-base()
  syl5ibrcom(w0, ¬¨ c1 ‚àà ùïå, (c0[|`s]c1)‚àà c2, ‚àÖ ‚àà c2)
  wun0(c2, w0)
  eleq1d((c0[|`s]c1), c2, emptycls, ¬¨ c1 ‚àà ùïå)
  ovprc2(c1, c0, cress)
  reldmress()
}
